conbody.p: The following known issues exist in Eucalyptus 3.1 and its dependencies. Please contact Eucalyptus support for known workarounds to these issues.

row.entry: Issue
Description
In rare cases, Windows Server 2003R2 instances will be unresponsive
Windows Server 2003R2 instance may stop responding when it is started after it has been stopped.
iSCSI target daemon shows poor performance on 32-bit RHEL 5
The open source iSCSI target daemon (tgtd) on 32-bit RHEL 5 shows poor performance the first time it is started.
A deregistered image appears in the deregistered state when the user runs euca-describe-images
This indicates that the image is not usable and has been deregistered. If you want the image to disappear from the list returned by euca-describe-images run euca-deregister again.
The Typica library will not work without modifications

The Typica client tools library expects an empty blockDeviceMapping element in the XML response returned by the RunInstances API call. Eucalyptus responds with a blockDeviceMapping element that contains the root device. For example, <blockDeviceMapping> <item> <deviceName>/dev/sda1</deviceName> </item> </blockDeviceMapping>
Image preparation fails on some KVM NCs
If you are using KVM and the size of the machine image (emi) is not a multiple of 512 bytes, image preparation on the Node Controller (NC) fails.
Maximum volume attachment limit with VMware
The maximum number of volumes that can be attached to a single Eucalyptus instance when using VMware is 14.
Default architecture for images is x86_64
When an EBS image is registered without supplying an architecture the image's architecture defaults to x86_64.
DescribeInstances response has a different time format from the RunInstances response

The format of the time stamp returned by the DescribeInstances API call slightly differs from the time stamp returned by the RunInstances call. For example, RunInstances might return 2012-01-11T17:32:01.894Z, whereas DescribeInstances might return 2012-01-11T17:32:01Z.
Security issue with ATA over Ethernet (AoE)

If you are using ATA over Ethernet (AoE) with Eucalyptus 2.0 and earlier, volumes exported on a subnet are accessible to all users on that network. We recommend that users use iSCSI with Eucalyptus 2.0 and later.
Failure to delete a security group with instances that are running is reported as a non-intuitive error message

An attempt to delete a security group with instances that are running will manifest as a non-intuitive error. For example: DeleteSecurityGroupType: Failed to delete security group: ec2opsgroup863 for arn:aws:euare::171316380579:user/admin because of: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not delete: [com.eucalyptus.network.ExtantNetwork#4028b3d533fc09620133fc15803f015a]
euca-authorize with an invalid network definition fails with a non-intuitive error message
For example: euca-authorize -s 0.0.0.0 -P tcp -p 22 default AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngressType: 1 This indicates that the request failed.
Cannot use a Xen kernel on the SC host with 32-bit installations
On 32-bit installations, the Xen kernel has a bug that prevents the Eucalyptus Storage Controller (SC) from creating volumes from snapshots. Please do not use a 32-bit Xen kernel on the SC host.
Issue with euca-deregister on an image with a deleted bundle

If an image is marked as deregistered, running the euca-deregister command again to get it to disappear from euca-describe-images will not work if the bundle has been deleted. The image is correctly deregistered and unusable, but will not disappear from the listing.
Synchronizing user data from LDAP is slow
Synchronizing over 1000 users from LDAP might take a few hours. This is generally a one-time administrative operation.
euca-release-address may not release an IP address that is associated with an instance

If euca-release-address is called on an IP address that was associated with an instance, the IP address will disassociated from the instance but not released until euca-release-address is called again.
The mac category missing in instance metadata
The mac category is not returned as part of instance metadata information.
Unable to use block devices with names higher than sdq with Xen
Due to a bug in Xen, when using Xen as the hypervisor, block devices with names that are "sdq" or higher cannot be attached to an instance. The user must use a device name that is smaller than sdq.
sdb not a valid name
Since "sdb" might be mapped to an ephemeral partition, Eucalyptus will not allow sdb as a valid name with "euca-attach-volume".
Error when accessing http://169.254.169.254/
When http://169.254.169.254/ a list of the available versions of the metadata is not returned. However, instance metadata is still available.
Co-located SC and VMware load issue

If you use the iSCSI open source backend driver and the SC host is busy creating large volumes or snapshots, or running large EBS-backed instances, the VMware Broker component might be disabled if it is running on the same host as the SC.
Public address lost after HA failover

When instances are running with assigned elastic IPs, an IP might be marked as available after a failover, when the new services go to enabled, even though they are still actually assigned to running instances.
Issue upgrading Walrus when using NetApp
Upgrades do not work correctly in environments that use NetApp NFS share as the Walrus backend. Eucalyptus tries to change permissions on the read-only .snapshot directory.
Issue upgrading after a reboot on Ubuntu LTS 10.04
If the CLC host is rebooted right before an upgrade without restarting Eucalyptus, the /var/run/eucalyptus directory does not exist and the upgrade will fail.
